title: Linux gzexe Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the gzexe command in Linux, learn how to compress and decompress executable files, and discover practical examples of its usage.

meta.title: Linux gzexe Command with Practical Examples
meta.description: Explore the gzexe command in Linux, learn how to compress and decompress executable files, and discover practical examples of its usage.
meta.keywords: Linux, gzexe, compression, executable, file, backup, practical examples

steps.title: Understand the Purpose and Functionality of gzexe Command

verify.name: Verify gzexe version
verify.hint: The gzexe version should be 1.10 or a compatible version. Please check the output of the `gzexe --version` command.

verify.name: Verify compressed file size
verify.hint: The compressed file size should be smaller than the original file size. Please check the output of the `du -h` command.

verify.name: Verify compressed file execution
verify.hint: The compressed file should execute and output "This is a sample executable file.". Please check the output of the compressed file execution.

steps.title: Decompress and Execute Compressed Executable Files

verify.name: Verify compressed file execution
verify.hint: The compressed file should execute and output "This is a sample executable file.". Please check the output of the compressed file execution.

verify.name: Verify decompressed file execution
verify.hint: The decompressed file should execute and output "This is a sample executable file.". Please check the output of the decompressed file execution.
